From: ' 
To: "Miller, Michael" < >, "Martin G. Weinberg" < 
Cc: "Wein arten Reid" "Gilbert Sara" 
Subject: RE: US v Epstein 
Date: Wed, 14 Aug 2019 22:07:42 +0000 
Mike, Marty, 
Following up on our prior conversations, we are able to provide you with the contact information for the Assistant U.S. 
Attorneys who are assigned to the investigation of Mr. Epstein's death. They are: 
I have also provided them with your contact information. 
thank you, 
From: Miller, Michael •it> 
Sent: Wednesday, August 14, 2019 16:52 
To: I<:.; Martin G. Weinberg <> 
Cc: 
I 
Weingarten, Reid ‹>  Gilbert, Sara 
Subject: RE: US v Epstein 
Why don't we use the following dial-in for tomorrow at 9:30? 
80943# 
Mike 
Michael 
C. 
Miller 
Partner 
Steptoe 
Steptoe & Johnson LLP 
1114 Avenue of the Americas I New York, NY 10036 
www.step[oe.com 
This message and any attached documents contain information from the law firm Steptoe & Johnson LLP that may be confidential and/or privileged. If you 
are not the intended recipient, please do not read. copy, distribute, or use this information. If you have received this transmission in error, please notify the 
sender immediately by reply e-mail and then delete this message. 
EFTA00020174

From: 
Sent: Wednesday, August 14, 2019 4:42 PM 
To: Martin G. Weinberg 
Cc: 
>; 
; Miller, Michael < Weingarten, Reid 
Subject: Re: US v Epstein 
Marty, 
That time works for us, thanks. Could you please circulate a dial-in? 
Thanks. 
Sent from my iPhone 
On Aug 14, 2019, at 11:23 AM, Martin G. Weinberg <> wrote: 
c 
M, Mike and I are authorized to continue the discussion of potential civil forfeiture issues with you. Are you available 
at 930 tomorrow morning? Thanks 
Martin G. Weinberg, Esq. 
Boston. MA 02116 
 This Electronic Message contains information from the Law

addressee only. If you are not the addressee, please note that any disclosure, copying, distribution, or use of
